meanings.definition: A photograph of a person's face, especially one taken for police records.
meanings.sent1: The police took a mugshot of the suspect after the arrest.
meanings.sent2: The mugshot helped the officers identify the criminal quickly.
meanings.sent3: The mugshot of the cat wearing sunglasses made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her tired eyes in the mugshot revealed the long night she had.
meanings.sent5: The vivid mugshot captured every detail of the man's face.

meanings.definition: A close-up photograph of a person's face, typically used for identification purposes.
meanings.sent1: The security guard checked the visitor's mugshot before allowing entry.
meanings.sent2: The mugshot displayed all the unique features of the individual.
meanings.sent3: The mugshot of the dog with a bowtie looked surprisingly formal.
meanings.sent4: Her smile in the mugshot was as bright as the sun.
meanings.sent5: The mugshot made it easy to recognize the missing person.
